monster_url: URL to the monster's reference page or image - (string)
monster_name: Name of the monster, typically unique or descriptive (string)
monster_type: Monster type, such as Beast, Celestial, Construct, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, Giant, Humanoid, Monstrosity, Ooze, Plant, Undead (string)
monster_alignment: Alignment of the monster, such as Lawful Good, Chaotic Evil, Neutral, etc. (string)
armor_class: Armor Class (AC), a number that indicates how hard it is to hit the monster (int)
armor_type: Type of armor or natural defense, like 'Natural Armor' or 'Chain Mail' (string)
hit_points: Total hit points (HP) of the monster, e.g., '85' (int)
hit_dice: Hit dice used to calculate hit points, e.g., '10d10+30' (string)
speed: Movement speed of the monster, e.g., '40 ft.' (string)
strength: Strength ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
dexterity: Dexterity ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
constitution: Constitution ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
intelligence: Intelligence ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
wisdom: Wisdom ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
charisma: Charisma ability score, a number between 1-30 (int)
darkvision_url: URL to a reference explaining darkvision or an image representing it (string)
darkvision: Description of darkvision range, e.g., 'Darkvision 60 ft.' (string)
passive_perception: Passive Perception score, a number based on Wisdom modifier and proficiency (int)
languages: Languages the monster can speak or understand, e.g., 'Common, Giant' (string)
challenge: Challenge rating (CR), a number between 0 and 30 representing the monster's difficulty (string)
proficiency_bonus: Proficiency bonus, calculated based on challenge rating (int)
special_ability_name: Name of a special ability or trait (string)
special_ability_description: Detailed description of the special ability or trait (string)
action_name_1: Name of the first action the monster can take (string)
action_name_1_description: Detailed description of the first action (string)
action_name: Name of another action the monster can take (string)
hit_roll: Formula for the attack roll, e.g., '1d20 + 6' (string)
hit_modifier: Modifier added to the attack roll, e.g., '+6' (string)
reach_distance: Reach distance for melee attacks, e.g., '10 ft.' (string)
damage_amount: Average damage dealt by the attack, e.g., '15 (2d8 + 4)' (string)
character_description: Detailed description of the NPC/character's appearance and notable traits (string)
proficiencies: Skills and proficiencies the character has, e.g., 'Strength, Athletics' (string)
special_skills: Any special skills the character possesses, e.g., 'Intimidation, Survival' (string)
unique_behaviors: Unique behaviors or habits, e.g., 'Enjoys crushing boulders and intimidating smaller creatures.' (string)
typical_attitude: Typical attitude or demeanor, e.g., 'Aggressive and territorial' (string)
useful_knowledge: Any useful knowledge the character has, e.g., 'Knows the locations of hidden caves and treasure troves in the mountains.' (string)
bonds: Bonds or relationships the character holds dear, e.g., 'Bound to his ogre tribe.' (string)
flaws_or_secrets: Flaws or secrets of the character, e.g., 'Has a fear of fire and can be easily spooked by it.' (string)
armor: Armor the character wears, if any, e.g., 'None' (string)
other_items: Other items the character carries, e.g., 'Tribal Totem' (string)
backstory: Detailed backstory of the character, e.g., 'Grog grew up in a tribe of ogres in the mountains, known for his immense strength and brutal nature. He now leads his tribe in raids against nearby settlements.' (string)
additional_notes: Any additional notes or information about the character, e.g., 'Despite his brute strength, Grog is not very intelligent and can be outwitted with clever tactics.' (string)
